description: A rare opportunity to live in this luxury new-build 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment apartment in the heart of London's Zone 1, located within the prestigious Postmark development. Positioned at the crossroads of two of London's most iconic postcodes-EC1 and WC1-this home forms part of the only large-scale residential project in this highly central location. Built on the historic site of the Royal Mail's Mount Pleasant sorting office, Postmark pays tribute to its heritage through refined architecture and contemporary design. <PARA> This 864 sqft apartment features thoughtfully planned interiors with warm wooden floors, high-quality fixtures, elegant finishes, and private balcony access. Flooded with natural light, the living room benefits from a fully-equipped kitchen with integrated appliances, delivering a sophisticated urban lifestyle. The 24/7 concierge service and secure, design-led environment enhance the sense of comfort and convenience. <PARA> Postmark is surrounded by cultural and educational landmarks. Just minutes away are the British Museum, British Library, Barbican Centre, and the vibrant streets of Exmouth Market. For shopping and entertainment, residents can easily reach Covent Garden and the creative hub of Old Street. <PARA> Transport links are exceptional. Surrounded by five major stations-Farringdon, Chancery Lane, Russell Square, Holborn, and King's Cross St Pancras-all within a 15-minute walk, Postmark offers unmatched connectivity across London and beyond. Residents enjoy easy access to seven Underground lines, the Elizabeth Line, and Eurostar routes from St Pancras International. From business in the City to leisure in Hyde Park or weekend escapes to Paris, travel is seamless and efficient. This is London living at its most connected, most cultural, and most convenient. <PARA> The development is also ideally placed near top-ranked schools such as: <PARA> * Westminster School (18 mins), <PARA> * Queen's College Preparatory School (22 mins), <PARA> * City of London School for Girls (25 mins). <PARA> Within walking distance are world-renowned universities including: <PARA> * UCL (20 mins), <PARA> * LSE (23 mins), <PARA> * KCL (27 mins), <PARA> * Central Saint Martins (26 mins), <PARA> * UAL (16 mins), <PARA> making it a top choice for students, professionals, and families alike.

title: 3 bedroom apartment for rent
description: In the heart of South Kensington, moments from the world-renowned Museum Quarter, rows of stately red-brick mansion blocks define the area’s distinguished architectural character. Occupying the lower-ground floors of one such building, this three-bedroom duplex apartment presents an elegant, minimalist backdrop for interior creativity. <PARA> A generous double reception room sets an immediate atmosphere of calm. Natural light pours through twin bay windows, highlighting a period fireplace that anchors the space with warmth. Whitewashed walls and pale timber floors reflect the light, creating an uplifting feel. <PARA> Beyond, a glass-fronted hallway offers a striking vantage point over the living area below, courtesy of a ceiling void. To one side sits a streamlined kitchen, where white cabinetry and integrated appliances form a clean, architectural composition. To the other, smart wood floors set the scene for a dining area. From this level, enjoy leafy views of the communal gardens – a verdant retreat for residents, especially in summer, when the manicured lawn comes into its own. <PARA> Descending to the lower level, a double-height living room unfolds with a voluminous, inviting presence. Floor-to-ceiling glazing welcomes in abundant natural light, while a contemporary fireplace is neatly recessed into the wall. From here, doors open directly onto Egerton Gardens, a cherished neighbourhood enclave punctuated by mature trees and quiet seating spots. <PARA> The bedrooms continue the home’s tranquil aesthetic. The principal suite is spacious and considered, a second bedroom suite offers comfort for guests, while a third bedroom provides flexibility – ideal as a study, studio, or dressing room. One additional bathroom completes the layout; throughout all three, marble surfaces envelop indulgent tubs and rainfall showers. <PARA> *Images feature CGI staging and are for illustrative purposes only – this property comes unfurnished. <PARA> Location <PARA> Moments from vibrant institutions like the Victoria & Albert Museum and the Natural History Museum, a sense of peace prevails. Grab a coffee to go from HJEM before a stroll around the museums, or head north to Hyde Park. Coveted local restaurants such as Margaux, Yashin Ocean House and Zuma are perfect for get-togethers. For a day of shopping, there’s Chelsea’s iconic Kings Road or the upmarket department stores of Knightsbridge to explore. Cultural evenings are well-spent at The Royal Albert Hall or Royal Court Theatre, or The Troubadour for live music. For fine dining, local haunts such as Margaux, Yashin Ocean House, and Zuma offer memorable experiences. <PARA> South Kensington - 8 mins <PARA>

title: 2 bedroom apartment for rent
description: Beyond a handsome Victorian red brick façade, a classic and clean reimagining of heritage living unfolds. A double reception room sits to the front, with a duo of bay windows, and French doors that open onto a private southeast-facing balcony. Stretching from floor to ceiling, the windows flood the space with natural light, illuminating oak floors, white walls and marble fireplaces at either end. <PARA> Through double doors, a contemporary kitchen is subtly separated from the entertaining space. Glossy black counters sit atop sleek white cabinetry, integrated with high-end appliances. French doors extend the room onto a rear balcony, offering elevated views over the communal garden. <PARA> Another pair of double doors lead from the reception room into a more intimate communal space, fitted with floor-to-ceiling storage, a compact modern fireplace and access to a third balcony. From here, steps descend to the principal bedroom suite, where the restrained palette continues. Its en suite bathroom is generous and serene, with a tiled bath, separate shower and direct access to the balcony overlooking the gardens. On the floor below, a guest bedroom suite echoes the same calm aesthetic and thoughtful layout. <PARA> *Images feature CGI staging and are for illustrative purposes only – this property comes unfurnished. <PARA> On a handsome street 15 minutes’ walk from Hyde Park, this eye-catching apartment is close to some of London’s best attractions and restaurants. Choose between the V&A Museum and the world-famous Royal Albert Hall, just a short stroll away. Local Michelin-starred restaurants include Amaya for refined Indian cuisine or Dinner by Heston Blumenthal for molecular gastronomy. Alternatively, spend the evening at Dinings SW3 before enjoying a nightcap at The Wilton Arms. <PARA> South Kensington - 8 mins (Circle & District, Piccadilly) <PARA>

title: Land for rent
description: Shiplake Lock, Mill Lane, Shiplake, Henley-on-Thames, RG9 3NA <PARA> Acting on behalf of the Environment Agency, Carter Jonas are pleased to offer 5 campsites to let in a unique location along the River Thames. Each site is positioned next to the lock and enjoy direct access to the picturesque Thames Path. <PARA> The Campsites <PARA> The permitted use of each of the sites is for campsite/recreational use and ancillary use in association with the campsite operating on a seasonal basis only in accordance with the current planning permission. The rents will be offered inclusive of utilities. Sub meters can be installed at the tenant’s cost. There are no electrical hookups to the individual campsite plots on any of the sites. <PARA> The landlords will retain rights of access for operational purposes in relation to the lock and weirs that are located on the individual sites. <PARA> The tenant of the campsite is to manage their own refuse and recycling on each of the individual campsites. Each site has access to 24-hour moorings on site with a fee payable to the Environment Agency. <PARA> Shiplake Lock <PARA> The campsite is located on an island in the centre of the River Thames adjacent to Shiplake Lock, near Henley on Thames. Access to the campsite is via the river or a footbridge only, there is no vehicular access to the island. <PARA> The site is level and has space for approximately 15-18 plots. Each of the plots currently consist of a timber building with a decking area which are in poor condition. <PARA> On site there is a toilet block with shower facilities which requires renovation/refurbishing. There are a number of timber outbuildings including a former boat storage shed and Siplake Lock three storage buildings which could be used as offices if required. <PARA> Access for campsite guests would be via the public footpath over the lock or by boat. Small boats can be launched from the public canoe portage located on the island. <PARA> Planning <PARA> Planning permission exists for the use of the site as a campsite along with a licence for camping under Section 269 of the Public Health Act 1936. Currently the plots are too close together and will need to be reduced under the current licence. A copy can be provided to bona fide tenants. Camping is permitted from Good Friday to 30th September. <PARA> Terms <PARA> The sites are offered to let by informal tender on new 10-year leases. For the avoidance of doubt, the leases will be contracted out of the Landlord & Tenant Act 1954 (Part II) provisions. Consideration may be given to proposals that include ancillary recreational uses such as watersports or boat, canoe and paddleboard hire. <PARA> Tenders are due by midday (12noon) on Wednesday 11th February 2026. Tender forms are available from the agents. <PARA> Quoting Rents <PARA> Shiplake Lock From £12,000 per annum <PARA> Services <PARA> Each site has mains water and a private sewerage system managed by the landlord (except for Shiplake which is connected to mains drainage) and there are no sub-meters in place at this stage. <PARA> Wayleaves, Easements & Rights of Way <PARA> The sites are being let subject to and with the benefit of all rights including; rights of way, whether public or private, light, sport, drainage, water and electricity supplies and other rights and obligations, easements and quasi easements and restrictive covenants and all existing proposed wayleaves for masts, pylons, stays, cables, drains, water and gas and other pipes whether referred to in these particulars or not. <PARA> Health & Safety <PARA> Please note that these are operational lock sites, which can be prone to flooding in bad weather. Potential tenants are required to take particular care when inspecting and are requested to wear supportive footwear for viewings, being mindful of potentially uneven, overgrown or slippery ground surfaces. <PARA> Viewings <PARA> Strictly by appointment only with agents Carter Jonas, Taunton office: . <PARA> What3Words <PARA> Shiplake Lock: ///darkens.trials.twitches <PARA>

In 2010 Goring was awarded the prestigious ?Oxfordshire Village of the Year? and also the coveted ?South of England? title. Fronting onto the river by the bridge crossing over to Goring is the luxury 4 star riverside hotel the Swan renowned for its fine cuisine and leisure and fitness facilities. <PARA> Thames Road is approached off the High Street opposite the Village Hall and just before going over the River Bridge into Streatley High Street. It is a highly regarded residential no-through road, tree lined and comprising a limited number of desirable individual properties many dating from around the turn of the last Century and reflecting the grand architectural style of the late Victorian and Edwardian eras. <PARA> PROPERTY DESCRIPTION <PARA> 18 Thames Bank is a lovely mews style property. There is a spacious entrance hall with a cloakroom, good size storage cupboard and staircase to the first floor. The Kitchen is fully fitted and enjoys views over the courtyard area. The Sitting/Dining room has double doors opening on the terrace. On the second floor there are two lovely double bedrooms with views over the courtyard. The neighbourhood, renowned for its grand white stucco facades and quiet mews, offers a tranquil residential atmosphere while being in the heart of London. Pimlico offers the excitement of central London as well as the tranquillity of secluded residential streets and green open spaces, calling Pimlico home means your lifestyle has endless variety. From the world-famous shopping of nearby Bond and Oxford Street to the newly redeveloped districts of Victoria, there’s always something to see or do. The area's cultural richness is immense, with a plethora of art dealers on Pimlico Road and proximity to world-class museums like the Victoria & Albert Museum and the Natural History Museum in nearby South Kensington. While Pimlico itself is a peaceful enclave, it has easy access to renowned theatres and cinemas like The Royal Court theatre on Sloane Square and Everyman Cinema in nearby Chelsea. For recreation and relaxation, residents enjoy exclusive private garden squares and many walk to the expansive green spaces of St. James’s Park and Hyde Park. Transport links are excellent, with multiple tube stations including Pimlico, St. James’s Park, Sloane Square and Victoria providing quick and easy access to the rest of London and beyond. Close by is the headquarters of John D Wood & Co on Belgrave Square and our hugely popular Elizabeth Street residential property office.
